alert.note: Alert for Harney (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 8:44AM PDT until May 02 at 11:22AM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boise ID has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... Silvies River Near Burns affecting Harney County. .Above normal temperatures are expected through the weekend which will increase snowmelt across the region. For the Silvies River...including Burns...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE TUESDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Silvies River Near Burns. * WHEN...From this morning to late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding of fields will occur in the Burns area. Water will encroach on some private properties along North Broadway Avenue, Foley Road, and Stancliff Road. Water will be close to flowing on to Highway 20 at the Silvies River Bridge. Low spots in the Burns RV Park may be impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM PDT Friday the stage was 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM PDT Friday was 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.4 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.5 feet on 03/08/1986. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM PDT.
